Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel for a budget stay”
Reviews.Author: Murat T
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights. The staff was fine, we had no problems. Our room was a bit small, anyway who spends his time in a hotel room in Rome, we used it only for sleeping, so it wasn't a problem for us. Hotel was clean, that is the most important thing in a hotel for me. I guess no rooms have a great view, Ours was looking at the street. I've noticed a couple of rooms have a bad view especially the ones at the breakfast floor. Wi-fi internet is free but the signal is very weak, so had to go down to lobby to connect to internet. Location is not bad, close to Termini however on the opposite side of everything to see in Rome, you have to walk 300 meters to the bus stop to go to Termini, which is only 2 stops away. It is also in a walking distance of 15 minutes. It is a good hotel to stay in Rome. I have no big complains.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money, with a Few Quibbles”
Reviews.Author: Trotamundos09
Reviews.Content: Thought I got a very reasonable rate for Easter Week, and was pleased for the most part and would recommend. Much nicer than the seedier budget options near Termini. Not far from a Metro station, and also walkable from Termini if you have light luggage. Neighborhood is not touristy, though lots of restaurant options nearby. Supermarket down the street plus a great traditional fruit/vegetable market at the corner as well. I had a single, room 307, modern decor -- looks like the rooms have been recently renovated. This room also has a balcony (one of only two in the hotel) that look out onto a quiet residential courtyard. Refrigerator/mini bar, and older CRT TV. Breakfast was included in the rate, and was quite good, including hot options like scrambled eggs and bacon, along with rolls, ham, cold cuts, cheese, and the ample sweet cakes as mentioned by other reviews. Since it was Easter, they also had lots of chocolate eggs. A few drawbacks. The shower stall in the otherwise spacious bathroom was tiny and the doors didn't seal well, so water got onto the floor outside. The toilet seat wasn't well-aligned so was wobbly. The room safe was malfunctioning (sounded like gears were slipping in the lock). The hotel is happy to let you store your luggage after checkout, but the storage facility is a room without any real security and access and retrieval of your bags is on the honor system. If you can live with that level of security ambiguity, you will be fine. Finally, the public toilet on the ground floor did not have a toilet seat (apparently not unusual in public toilets in Rome!), so I pitied the women guests who needed to use it to freshen up. All in all, as I said in my headline, good value for money if you are willing to make some compromises, are self-sufficient, and perhaps have been to Rome before.

Reviews.Title: “Great economy hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlobalguyOttawa
Reviews.Content: You will find good value here if you don't expect too much. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The location is central enough to be able to walk to all major sights or take the metro. I especially like the Allessandria market. Chockfulbof farmers stalls and food vendors only one block away. It is only a ten minute walk to villa Botghese. The rooms are small but this is old Europe. The carpets have seen better days. The collazione is standard fare. Wifi is reliable. Overall a very good value for the price. Check several web vendors to find the best deal.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for low budgets”
Reviews.Author: ELENI A
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I visited this hotel and I have chosen it again because of the good value money-services.The hotel is very clean,with good breakfast,free wi-fi,good location with many good restaurants around,public transportation very close that takes you everywhere in Rome.The only negative is that the bathrooms need a renovation but still its ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean, modern hotel. Ok location with several good restaurants and bars close by.”
Reviews.Author: Jbkershaw
Reviews.Content: A good choice for a city break over a few days. Amenities not huge but clean modern with pleasant staff. The location is ok, 20 to 30 mins walk to centre of rome or to metro/bus station. €7 taxi to city centre. Rooms are clean tidy and modern. Bathroom was similar. Only issue we had was the beds are very hard, perhaps too hard, but it's a subjective criticism. Breakfast was plentiful, buffet style, but need to get there early as at the weekends it's very busy and the staff (only 2) are over worked and a its a little disorganised. Fare was good though. Overall would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Find Another Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Constantina P
Reviews.Content: Our stay in this hotel was one of the worse experiences ever. They lacked customer service and hospitality. This hotel was so small that many of the residents and taxi drivers did not know that it existed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: merxell
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Hotel Lloyd, Rome. The hotel was very good value for money compared to the level of Rome hotels. Location is a bit far but still walkable to the historic centre. Also the metro station is about 5-10 mins walk which helps a lot. Hotel room was clean and nice with a good king size bed and it was also very quiet. Shower was very nice also. Breakfast was simple but you get good coffee and nice sandwich to fill your energy for a walk around the beautiful city of Rome. The service of the staff could have been more helpful though.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice for the budget traveller.”
Reviews.Author: superhomem
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights. In brief it is a simple, quiet hotel targeting mostly business travellers. We were more than satisfied with our stay there for the following reasons: 1) Very good value for money 2) Standard conventional rooms (warm and clean) 3) Satisfying simple breakfast 4) Among excellent/typical italian and more than reasonably priced trattorias,cafes,gelaterias,shops and wine bars frequented by locals 5) Quiet street One minus was the location (3 bus/tram stops from a Metro station). However, with the frequency of the Roman Transport System (bus every 3-5 minutes), it was not a big deal afterall. What we found on site was that the prices offered by phone/email/website were even lower than the offers in booking sites, which could save us an extra 2 person dinner in the excellent pizzeria across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel away from the urges of city life”
Reviews.Author: Clemence_James
Reviews.Content: We are back from a week end trip in rome and chose this hotel as it came at a very good deal (paid half of the advertised price on a last minute deal). The hotel is very clean, recently refurbished. the staff is nice too. The rooms are very comfortable and roomy, extra plus to the super-powerful shower, perfect for those early mornings after a long day before. The mattress and pillows are firm, to my liking but alas not to my husband's. The breakfast was good, though not too much savoury choice. the pastries were also industrially made, lacking that home-made feel. Will definitely return if we come back on a tourity trip.

Reviews.Title: “Eat and shop where the Romans do...”
Reviews.Author: msenigo
Reviews.Content: If you do not mind walking a few extra blocks, this hotel is a good value. On weekdays, it seemed to be primarily a 'busineess' crowd. On the weekend, it was mostly European tourists. It was very quiet and it was just out of the tourist 'zone', so you really got the feeling that you were living with the locals at the shops and restaurants. It was nice to escape the tourist 'throngs' after a day of site-seeiong...

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel! Our best hotel during our trip to Italy!”
Reviews.Author: GatorTravels1000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited four cities, and when we came back to Rome the day before returning to the US, we booked a room at the Hotel Lloyd. It was by far the best hotel room we stayed in during our whole trip. It was like the American hotels we are used to, but that is a good thing. There are high ceilings, elevators, solid air-conditioning, soft slippers, plush towels, and a normal-sized shower. Our room was really, really clean! Also, it was a great value for what we paid! The only bad thing about the hotel is that it is not close to the train station or anything touristy, like the Colosseum or the Vatican. This worked out fine for us because we had already seen everything during the first leg of our trip, but if you are just arriving in Rome, you might want to stay somewhere more centrally located. Other than that, we really enjoyed our stay here, and the staff was very friendly and helpful when it came to finding a good place to eat in the area or getting a cab back to the train station.
